intro: Agelanthus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often in shades of pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Agelanthus lancifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
